name: spread
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause to) cover, reach, or have an effect on a wider or increasing area
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）展开，（使）铺开；（使）蔓延，（使）扩散

example.eg: The fire spread very rapidly because of the strong wind.
example.egtrans: 风很大，火势迅速蔓延开来。

example.eg: It started off as cancer of the liver but it spread to other areas of the body.
example.egtrans: 开始的时候是肝癌，后来扩散到了身体的其他部位。

example.eg: The redundancies are spread across the banking and building industries.
example.egtrans: 裁员之风席卷了银行业和建筑业。

example.eg: We spread the picnic rug out on the ground and sat down to eat.
example.egtrans: 我们把野餐毯铺在地上，坐下来吃东西。

example.eg: The virus is spread (= given to other people) through contact with blood and other body fluids.
example.egtrans: 病毒通过血液及其他体液的接触而传染。

example.eg: Are you spreading (= telling a lot of people) gossip/rumours again?
example.egtrans: 你是不是又在四处散播谣言了？

example.eg: If we spread (= divide) the work between us, it won't seem so bad.
example.egtrans: 如果我们大家分担一下工作，情况可能就没那么糟糕了。

example.eg: She spread her toast with a thick layer of butter./She spread a thick layer of butter on her toast.
example.egtrans: 她在吐司上涂了厚厚的一层黄油。

example.eg: It's a special sort of butter that spreads easily even when cold.
example.egtrans: 这是一种很特别的黄油，在凉的时候也很容易涂抹。

example.eg: The suburbs spread (out) for miles to either side of the city.
example.egtrans: 郊区向城市两边都伸展出数英里。

example.eg: Slowly a smile spread across her face.
example.egtrans: 她的脸上慢慢露出了微笑。

name: spread
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the development or growth of something so that it covers a larger area or affects a larger number of people

example.eg: The spread of the disease in the last few years has been alarming.
example.egtrans: 近几年这种疾病的广泛传播着实令人担忧。

trans_examp.trans_en: the area or range covered by something

example.eg: The survey found a wide spread of opinion over the proposed new building.
example.egtrans: 调查广泛征集了对于拟议中的新建筑的意见。

trans_examp.trans_en: a large article or advertisement covering one or more pages in a newspaper or magazine
trans_examp.trans_cn: 整版（或横贯几版的）文章（或广告）

example.eg: There's a double-page spread on the latest fashions.
example.egtrans: 有一篇横贯两版的文章介绍最新的时尚。

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a soft food for putting on bread and biscuits
trans_examp.trans_cn: 涂在面包（或饼干）上的食物；酱

example.eg: There's bread and various spreads for tea.
example.egtrans: 茶点有面包和各种抹酱。

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         ranch   or other large area of land or water

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a meal, especially one for a special occasion with a lot of different dishes arranged on a table

example.eg: Sheila laid on (= made) a magnificent spread for us.
example.egtrans: 希拉为我们准备了丰盛的饭菜。

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the difference between two amounts, such as two prices or interest rates
trans_examp.trans_cn: 差异，差距；（价格或利率等之间的）差额

example.eg: The issue was priced at a spread of 115 basis points above Treasury bonds.
example.egtrans: 这一期的价格定在比财政部债券高115点的位置。
